    {"s":"diffuse optical spectroscopy", "p":"measures", "o":"oxygen saturation", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Now, by measuring how much light gets through at two or more wavelengths, we can solve for unknowns in the tissue."},
    {"s":"diffuse optical spectroscopy", "p":"uses", "o":"Beer's law", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Mathematically, it’s quite straightforward. The transmitted intensity follows Beer’s law — I equals I naught times e to the power of minus mu-a times L, where mu-a is the absorption coefficient and L is the path length."},
    {"s":"pulse oximeter", "p":"uses", "o":"diffuse optical spectroscopy", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"In fact, this is exactly the principle used in a pulse oximeter — that little clip you put on your finger in the hospital."},

evidence: In fact, this is exactly the principle used in a pulse oximeter - that little clip you put on your finger in the hospital.
